greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into parts 4k.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..16384
mathematica: nmax=100; CoefficientList[Series[Product[1/(1 - x^(4 k)), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 04 2018 *)
nmax = 50; kmax = nmax/4; s = Range[0, kmax]*4;
Table[Count[IntegerPartitions@n, x_ /; SubsetQ[s, x]], {n, 0, nmax}] (* _Robert Price_, Aug 03 2020 *)
results.author: _Olivier Gérard_
ext: Error in offset corrected by _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 26 2015
